metadata.Title: CVE-2015-1209 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Use-after-free vulnerability in the VisibleSelection::nonBoundaryShadowTreeRootNode function in core/editing/VisibleSelection.cpp in the DOM implementation in Blink, as used in Google Chrome before 40.0.2214.111 on Windows, OS X, and Linux and before 40.0.2214.109 on Android, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service or possibly have unspecified other impact via crafted JavaScript code that triggers improper handling of a shadow-root anchor.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-1209` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 40.0.2214.111-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1069
chromium-browser-l10n - 40.0.2214.111-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1069
chromium-chromedriver - 40.0.2214.111-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1069
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 40.0.2214.111-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1069
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 40.0.2214.111-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1069
No subscription required

liboxideqt-qmlplugin - 1.4.3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
liboxideqtcore0 - 1.4.3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
liboxideqtquick0 - 1.4.3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqmlscene - 1.4.3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-chromedriver - 1.4.3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-codecs - 1.4.3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-codecs-extra - 1.4.3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required
